description: Format error messages in plain, user-friendly language with actionable next steps

optional_params.name: context
optional_params.description: What the user was trying to do

response_format.suggested_actions: array of what user can do next

error_message_principles: Never show stack traces or technical jargon
Explain what went wrong in simple terms

common_error_templates.database_error: Something went wrong [saving/updating/deleting] the article. Please try again, or let me know if you need help.
common_error_templates.not_found: I couldn't find that article. It may have been deleted or you might mean a different one.
common_error_templates.duplicate: An article with a similar title already exists. Would you like to create it with a different title, or update the existing one?
common_error_templates.permission_denied: You don't have permission to [action] this article. Please contact your administrator.
common_error_templates.rate_limited: We've hit a rate limit. Please wait a moment and try again.
common_error_templates.validation_failed: I need more information to [action]. [What's missing]?
common_error_templates.service_unavailable: [Service name] isn't responding right now. Please try again in a few minutes.
common_error_templates.partial_failure: [What succeeded], but [what failed]. [What they have now] [What they can do next]
common_error_templates.quota_exceeded: [Resource] quota reached. [Contact support / try again tomorrow].

usage_notes: Always provide at least one suggested action
For partial failures, clearly state what worked and what didn't
Include article title/link in message when applicable
Severity=high for data loss risks or service outages
Severity=medium for failed operations (no data lost)
Severity=low for validation errors or user mistakes
Log technical details for debugging but don't show to user
Suggest retry for transient errors (network, timeouts)
Suggest alternative approach when feature unavailable

not_found: List all articles to find it
service_unavailable: Try again in a few minutes
Let me know if it persists
